title: PolarizationOptics
description: This describes an optical polarization device positioned in the light path for one or more channel available for this instrument. A polarization device is an optical filter that lets light waves of a specific polarization pass through while blocking light waves of other polarizations.

subCategoriesOrder.ManufacturerSpec: This describes the manufacturer specifications for this component (i.e., manufacturer name, model designation and serial number).
subCategoriesOrder.PolarizationOptics: This describes an optical polarization device positioned in the light path for one or more channel available for this instrument. A polarization device is an optical filter that lets light waves of a specific polarization pass through while blocking light waves of other polarizations.
subCategoriesOrder.WavelengthRange: This records a range of wavelengths this device is designed for according to the manufacturer. Multiple of this elements may be used.

Name.description: A user defined name for this component.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

Function.description: This field records whether this polarizer optics is used to generate or to analyze polarized light.

Construction.description: The modality with which this polarization device is constructed.

Fabrication.description: The way in with which this polarization device is fabricated.

Retardation.description: Retardation describes the phase shift between the polarization component projected along the fast axis and the component projected along the slow axis

MaterialName.description: This records the chemical composition or the nonproprietary trade designation of the material this polarization device is made of.

GlassCode.description: If available provide the international glass code for the glass this polarization device is made of. This is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and is a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its refractive index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe number Vd also taken at that line. The resulting glass code is the value of nd-1 rounded to three digits, followed by Vd rounded to three digits, with all decimal points ignored. For example, BK7 has nd = 1.5168 and Vd = 64.17, giving a six-digit glass code of 517642.

WavelengthRange.description: This records a range of wavelengths this device is designed for, according to the manufacturer. Multiple of this elements may be used.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.
